properties.Name: BondCallSchedule
properties.Description:
When a bond is issued, the issuer may have the option to call (redeem) the bond on specified dates and prices prior to maturity.  

A call schedule is a list of the dates that a bond can be called, together with the corresponding price for each call date.

Columns.Name: BondId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Financial Product.

Columns.Name: CallDate
Columns.Description:
A specific bond call date.

When a bond is issued, the issuer may have the option to call (redeem) the bond on specified dates and prices prior to maturity. The list of dates on which a specified bond can be called is shown in a call schedule.

Columns.Name: CallPremiumPercentage
Columns.Description: The dollar amount, normally stated as a percentage of principal amount, paid by the issuer as a penalty for the exercise of the call provision.

Columns.Name: CallPriceAmount
Columns.Description: The amount for which the bond may be called.

Properties.Description:
When a bond is issued, the issuer may have the option to call (redeem) the bond on specified dates and prices prior to maturity.  

A call schedule is a list of the dates that a bond can be called, together with the corresponding price for each call date.
